posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Help works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Help functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

My DM interprets Help differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Help. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Help that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
